result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L Genous was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $2337.93 to be paid to the following: $1894.00 to Home Depot, and $443.93 to Pick N Save.  Bail applied to restitution.  Remainder of restitution to be paid as a condition of probation.  Restitution to be paid before costs or fines.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with any Home Depot or Pick N Save Store.
No contact with Carrington Wright.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Matter reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 8/1/2016, 16 days sentence credit granted.
Received August 1, 2016, dated July 31, 2016 from ADA Galaviz, State is not objecting to the defendant's motion
dated July 28, 2016 from Br 3 requesting State's response to Atty Murray's July 18, 2016 letter.
Received July 20, 2016, dated July 18, 2016 from Atty Daniel Murray, regarding incarceration credit
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kenneth L Genous in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Repeater enhancer is sticken. Cases #15CM522, 15CM1393, and 15CM1565 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Murray makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

__36 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - _ days)
  -  __ 18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  __ 18 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Home Depot or Pick N Save Store. 
____No contact with: Carrington Wright
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges)
____40 Hours of Community Service
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

RESTITUTION:  $1894.00 to Home Depot, $ 443.93 to Pick N Save (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 90 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 45 days STAYED. Defendant must report BY 07/11/16 by 3:15 pm.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 15CM1565, 15CM1393, 15CM522, and 15CF1195 called.  Defendant Kenneth L Genous in court with attorney Daniel P. Murray.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Murray moves for an adjournment of the plea hearing due to defendant's medical issues.  Court adjourns this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
